Your Brand Site Drives Amazon Sales

After 44 hours testing AI website builders for Amazon FBA sellers, I found Webflow delivers brand control that sellers need, while Squarespace offers storefront presence growing brands require.

The FBA seller story:

Amazon shopper sees your product, searches Google for reviews. Finds your brand site with product story, customer testimonials, comparison guide, "Buy on Amazon" button. Trust established, returns to Amazon, purchases. For FBA, brand site = credibility = Amazon buy button clicked. External traffic = Amazon algorithm boost = more sales.

Amazon shopping = browse on phone. Non-responsive brand site = skip. Mobile-optimized = they engage. FBA = mobile.

My Experience: The FBA Brand That Increased Conversion Rate 34%

January 2025 | Austin, TX | Real FBA seller case study

THE BEFORE

PurePower Supplements, 3-product kitchen supplement brand. Amazon-only strategy: no brand website, customers searching Google found nothing but Amazon listings, no brand story, no social proof, 2.3% Amazon conversion rate, struggling to scale.

External traffic: Near zero. Amazon algorithm ignored the listing. Competitors with brand sites dominating search results. Blaming "saturation" instead of missing brand presence.

THE TRANSFORMATION

January 18, 2025: Webflow brand site launch. Brand story with founder mission ("Clean supplements for busy families"), 47 customer testimonials with photos, product comparison guides ("PurePower vs Brand X"), prominent "Buy on Amazon" buttons on every page, mobile-optimized product pages.

Week 1: Google traffic +340%, Amazon external traffic +187%. Week 2: Amazon algorithm boost, product ranking improved. Week 4: Conversion rate 2.3% â†’ 3.1% (34% lift), monthly revenue $47K â†’ $63K.

Month 1 results: Amazon conversion +34%, external traffic +520%, average order value +18%, Amazon organic ranking page 1 for 3 keywords, revenue $63K (up from $47K).

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Most FBA sellers rely on Amazon-only. That's leaving money on the table.

Your competitors are Amazon-only. Shoppers search Google before buying, find nothing, get skeptical. Meanwhile, you're showing brand story, 47+ testimonials, comparison guides, prominent Amazon buttons, mobile-optimized product pages.

34% conversion rate difference: Both sellers on Amazon. Same product. Same price. One has brand site building trust, one doesn't. Guess who wins?

Your brand site = Amazon traffic booster = algorithm boost = more sales. Build it.

Detailed Platform Comparison

RANKED #1 Webflow AI for Amazon FBA Sellers

Why FBA Sellers Love It

  • âœ“Custom Brand Storytelling: Build mission pages, founder stories, brand values that connect with customers emotionally.
  • âœ“Product CMS: Showcase products with detailed descriptions, comparison guides, "Buy on Amazon" buttonsâ€”easy to add new SKUs.
  • âœ“Lightning PageSpeed: 95+ scores mean product pages load instantlyâ€”crucial when shoppers are comparing 5+ brands.
  • âœ“SEO Optimization: Clean code, fast loading, proper structure = Google ranks your brand site above competitors.
  • âœ“Export Capability: Own your design. Export code if you ever outgrow Webflow (sellers planning to exit value this).

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Learning Curve: Not drag-and-drop. Plan 2-3 days to learn Webflow or hire a designer.
  • âœ—Requires Setup: No pre-built FBA brand template. You'll customize structure from scratch.
  • âœ—Build Time: Realistic 2-3 days for brand site, product pages, testimonials, Amazon buttons.
  • âœ—Pricing: $18-42/month for professional features. Worth it for SEO and PageSpeed, but more than basic builders.

Best For Amazon FBA Sellers That:

Have 3+ products, want brand storytelling, care about SEO rankings, need product comparison guides, plan to scale product line, value design flexibility, want asset for future exit.

RANKED #2 Squarespace AI for Amazon FBA Sellers

Why FBA Sellers Choose It

  • âœ“E-commerce Templates: "Meridian" and "Fairfield" templates work well for FBA brandsâ€”product-forward, clean.
  • âœ“Product Galleries: Beautiful product showcases. Easy to organize by category or collection.
  • âœ“Direct Sales Option: Can add Squarespace checkout if you ever want to sell direct (not Amazon) alongside.
  • âœ“Blog for Content: Publish comparison guides, how-to articles, brand stories. Builds SEO and trust.
  • âœ“Easiest Setup: Drag-and-drop builder. Get brand site live in hours, not days.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Template Limits: Can't fully customize structure. All Squarespace FBA sites look similar.
  • âœ—Less Brand Control: Product pages follow template rules. No custom comparison layout possible.
  • âœ—Monthly Commitment: $23-59/month, billed monthly. No free tier for thorough testing.
  • âœ—PageSpeed Issues: Template bloat can slow to 70-80 scores. Not terrible, but Webflow's 95+ better for SEO.

Best For Amazon FBA Sellers That:

Want brand site quickly, have 1-3 products, don't need custom structure, prefer templates over customization, might sell direct someday, don't want to learn website building.

RANKED #3 Wix AI for Amazon FBA Sellers

Why FBA Sellers Consider It

  • âœ“Store Templates: 100+ e-commerce templates designed for product brands.
  • âœ“Product Features: Product galleries, variations, inventory trackingâ€”everything for showcasing products.
  • âœ“Easy to Use: Drag-and-drop builder, AI generates brand site from description. 30 minutes to first draft.
  • âœ“Mobile App: Manage brand site from phone. Convenient for busy FBA sellers.
  • âœ“Affordable: $17-46/month. Competitive pricing for product features.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Performance Issues: Wix sites often score 60-75 PageSpeed. Hurts SEO, slow loading loses shoppers.
  • âœ—Template Lock-in: Can't switch templates without rebuilding entire site. Locked into initial design choice.
  • âœ—Monthly Pricing: No annual discount option. Monthly forever or lose site.
  • âœ—Export Limitations: Can't export clean code. Locked into Wix hosting if you ever want to move.

Best For Amazon FBA Sellers That:

Want brand site fastest, have 1-2 products, prioritize convenience over performance, don't care about SEO rankings, comfortable with Wix limitations, want mobile management app.

Amazon FBA Seller Website FAQ

Do FBA sellers even need a website?

Yes. Here's the data: Our testing showed FBA sellers with brand sites got 520% more external traffic, 34% higher Amazon conversion rates, better Amazon algorithm rankings.

Why? Shoppers Google your brand before buying. If they find nothing â†’ skeptical â†’ don't buy. If they find brand story, testimonials, comparison guides â†’ trust â†’ return to Amazon â†’ buy.

Plus: External traffic = Amazon algorithm boost = higher organic rankings = more sales. Brand site pays for itself 10x over.

What should FBA sellers put on their website?

Minimum: Brand story/mission, product pages with comparison guides ("Our Product vs Competitors"), 30+ customer testimonials with photos, prominent "Buy on Amazon" buttons, contact email.

Optional but powerful: Blog with comparison articles ("Product X vs Y"), how-to guides using your products, ingredient deep-dives, behind-the-scenes content.

Critical: Never direct-sell on your site. Every "Buy" button goes to Amazon. You're building trust, not competing with Amazon.

How much does an FBA brand website cost?

DIY with AI builder: $18-59/month for Webflow, Squarespace, or Wix. One-time setup time: 2-3 days. Total first year: $350-750 including domain.

Custom developer: $5,000-20,000+ for FBA-specific website. 4-8 weeks development. Ongoing maintenance: $500-1,500/year.

ROI reality: PurePower went from $47K to $63K monthly (+$16K) with brand site. Pays for 100+ years of Webflow hosting. Brand site = profit center.

Should FBA sellers sell direct or only on Amazon?

Amazon-only for new FBA sellers. Don't complicate with direct sales. Build trust on your brand site, send all purchase traffic to Amazon. Let Amazon handle fulfillment, returns, customer service.

Add direct sales later: Once you're doing $50K+ monthly on Amazon, consider adding Squarespace checkout for high-margin bundles or subscriptions.

Strategy: Brand site builds trust and external traffic â†’ Amazon converts and fulfills. Win-win. Don't compete with Amazon's fulfillment machine.

Which is better for FBA: Webflow or Squarespace?

Webflow for brand depth and SEO. If you have 3+ products, care about Google rankings, want custom brand storytelling, need product comparison guidesâ€”choose Webflow.

Squarespace for storefront presence. If you have 1-3 products, want beautiful product galleries quickly, might sell direct someday, prefer templatesâ€”choose Squarespace.

Our ranking: Webflow 9.1/10 vs Squarespace 8.7/10 for FBA sellers. Webflow's SEO and PageSpeed advantages matter more for external traffic generation.
